task.title: Reset or reuse a MediaPlayer instance
task.shortdesc: When you reset a MediaPlayer instance, it is returned to its uninitialized IDLE state as defined in MediaPlayerState.

context.p:
This operation is useful in the following cases:
You want to reuse a MediaPlayer instance but need to load a new MediaResource (video content) and replace the previous instance.
Resetting allows you to reuse the MediaPlayer instance without the overhead of releasing resources, recreating the MediaPlayer, and reallocating resources.
When the MediaPlayer is in an ERROR state and needs to be cleared. This is the only way to recover from the ERROR state.

step.cmd: Call reset to return the MediaPlayer instance to its uninitialized state:
Use MediaPlayer.replaceCurrentResource to load another MediaResource.

info.note: To clear an error, load the same MediaResource.

step.cmd: When you receive the STATUS_CHANGED event callback with PREPARED status, start the playback.
